speaker: Doctor
text: "Can you tell me more about when you first started having trouble feeding and when the abdominal distension began, was it sudden or did it come on gradually?"

speaker: Patient
text: "Oh, it started a few days ago, I think. My mom was feeding me and I was just not interested in eating. Then, yesterday, she said I was feeling really uncomfortable and my tummy was all... bulging out. It was pretty noticeable, even to her."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Can you show me exactly where the bulging is? Is it more noticeable when you're sitting up versus lying down?"

speaker: Patient
text: "Hmm, I think it's more noticeable when I'm lying down. I feel like my tummy is really tight and squished when I'm on my back. It's hard to explain, but I feel like I'm holding my breath a lot when I'm lying down too."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Okay, so it sounds like the bulging is more pronounced when you're lying down and you're experiencing discomfort and feeling like you're holding your breath. Can you tell me if you've noticed any other symptoms, like vomiting or diarrhea, or if you've had any fever?"

text: "No, nothing like that. Just the feeling of discomfort and the bulging. My mom says I've been crying a lot, especially when she presses on my tummy. It hurts a little."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Okay, so it sounds like the discomfort is quite pronounced when your mom presses on your tummy. Can you tell me more about what happens when she presses on it? Does it hurt immediately, or does it take a few seconds to feel the pain?"

speaker: Patient
text: "It hurts a little bit, I guess. It's hard to explain, but when she presses on it, I start crying and I try to move away. It feels like my tummy is really sensitive and it's hard for me to relax when she's touching it like that."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Okay, so it sounds like the pressure on your tummy can be quite painful and uncomfortable for you. Can you tell me if you've noticed any other changes in your behavior or mood, like being more irritable or restless?" "I guess so... I don't want to eat, and I don't want to play. I just want to lie down and rest. And I get really mad when my mom tries to pick me up or hold me because my tummy hurts."

speaker: Patient
text: "I just feel really uncomfortable all the time, and I don't know why. I just want to be left alone and rest. My tummy hurts, and it makes me cry when my mom presses on it."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Okay, I think I understand that you're feeling quite uncomfortable and in pain, especially when your mom presses on your tummy. My mom says she's fine, and my dad says he's fine too. But sometimes my mom gets a funny feeling in her tummy and she has to go see a doctor. I don't know what that means, but she says it's not the same as my tummy."

speaker: Patient
